title: Tight Junction Proteins at the Crossroads of Inflammation, Barrier Function, and Disease Modulation.
summary: Tight junctions (TJs), traditionally considered static structural elements sealing epithelial and endothelial monolayers, are now recognized as dynamic regulators of tissue homeostasis [...]....
abstract: Tight junctions (TJs), traditionally considered static structural elements sealing epithelial and endothelial monolayers, are now recognized as dynamic regulators of tissue homeostasis [...].
